item.description:
Where: Halibut Point State Park, Rockport MA
When: 9a.m.
Meeting Place: Parking area.
Admission: Free



Cape Ann Photography Excursion (CAPE) Group will revisit
Halibut Point State Park for our 1 year anniversary. Join us in the parking area at 9a.m. for coffee and donuts in celebration of our 1 year anniversary before we head into the park. Originally chosen for the diversity of photo opportunities, Halibut State Park offers something for everyone, regardless of photographic interest.

If you're interested in spending the day in Rockport, be sure to check out the 4th Annual Rockport Harvest Festival in downtown Rockport from 10a.m.-6p.m. Activities include public visits to the navy ship USS Hall, a Harvest Market, kayak relay race, music , entertainment, and much more. See the full weekend schedule here.


Halibut Point State Park Details:

Admission Fees: Pedestrians and bicyclists free.
State park staff on duty year-round; hours vary.
Recreational Opportunities: Bird watching; Fishing; Hiking; Nature study; Picnicking; Scenic Vistas
Current Acreage: 12
Trails 2.5 miles of trails. Moderate walking.

Facilities/Amenities
The state park operates a small visitor center and museum devoted to Halibut Point's natural history and Cape Ann's historic granite quarrying industry, of which Halibut Point's Babson Farm Quarry was a major part.
item.name: CAPE Group Anniversary Meetup: Halibut Point State Park
